analyzed: sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo // chos rnams spros dang bcas pa ni //
translated: Homage to the Buddha.üîΩThe Buddha taught the Dharma

analyzed: dpal ldan rang nyid kun mkhyen nas //

analyzed: de ltar sems can la gsung gang //

original: thams cad rig pa de la 'dud //
analyzed: thams cad rig pa de la 'dud //
translated: I bow to him, the Omniscient One.üîΩThe Sage taught in briefüîΩThat phenomena are of two types:

analyzed: de dag rnam par nges pa ni // bdag nyid 'ba' zhig dran phyir bshad //

original: chos mdor bsdus na rnam pa gnyis nyid de /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos mdor bsdus na rnam pa gnyis nyid de / 'di lta ste /
translated: In brief, phenomena are of two types:

original: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas so //
translated: Conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de la 'dus byas ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la 'dus byas ni mi rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The conditioned is impermanent.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rtag pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rtag pa nyid do //
translated: The unconditioned is permanent.

original: yang 'dus byas ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the conditioned is the conventional truth.

original: 'dus ma byas ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is the ultimate truth.

original: yang 'dus byas ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'o //
translated: The conditioned is that which arises in dependence.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is that which does not arise in dependence.

original: yang 'dus byas ni bla na yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni bla na yod pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is that which has a superior.

original: 'dus ma byas ni bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni bla na med pa'o //
translated: The unconditioned is that which has no superior.

original: yang 'dus byas ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is mundane.

original: 'dus ma byas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni 'jig rten las 'das pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is supramundane.

original: yang 'dus byas ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is both material and immaterial.

original: 'dus ma byas ni gzugs can ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni gzugs can ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only immaterial.

original: yang 'dus byas ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is both contaminated and uncontaminated.

original: 'dus ma byas ni zag pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni zag pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only uncontaminated.

original: yang 'dus byas ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is both afflicted and unafflicted.

original: 'dus ma byas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only unafflicted.

original: yang 'dus byas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byad pa pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byad pa pa'o //
translated: The conditioned is both afflicted and purified.

original: 'dus ma byas ni rnam par byad pa pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni rnam par byad pa pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only the perfected.

original: yang 'dus byas ni spang bya dang blang bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni spang bya dang blang bya'o //
translated: Again, the conditioned is that which is to be abandoned and that which is to be undertaken.

original: 'dus ma byas ni blang bya kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni blang bya kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only that which is to be undertaken.

original: yang 'dus byas ni brten par bya ba dang brten par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni brten par bya ba dang brten par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Again, the conditioned is that which is to be relied upon and that which is not to be relied upon.

original: 'dus ma byas ni brten par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni brten par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only that which is to be relied upon.

original: yang 'dus byas ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: Again, the conditioned is virtuous, nonvirtuous, and indeterminate.

original: 'dus ma byas ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only virtuous and indeterminate.

original: de la dge ba ni gcig ste /
analyzed: de la dge ba ni gcig ste /
translated: Among them, the virtuous is one,

original: 'di ltar so sor brtag pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor brtag pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: namely, analytical cessation.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The indeterminate is twofold,

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' dang so sor brtag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' dang so sor brtag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: namely, space and nonanalytical cessation.

original: yang 'dus byas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam grangs @109b su gtogs pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rnam grangs @109b su gtogs pa dang gzugs kyi khams kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: Again, the conditioned is included in the categories of the desire realm, the categories of the form realm, and the categories of the formless realm.

original: 'dus ma byas ni zag pa med pa'i khams kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni zag pa med pa'i khams kyi rnam grangs su gtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is included only in the categories of the uncontaminated realm.

original: yang 'dus byas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dang lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa dang kun 'byung gi bden pa dang lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: Again, the conditioned is the truth of suffering, the truth of origin, and the truth of the path.

original: 'dus ma byas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only the truth of cessation.

original: yang 'dus byas ni sdug bsngal gyis thob pa dang kun 'byung gis thob pa dang 'gog pas thob pa dang lam gyis thob pa dang bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni sdug bsngal gyis thob pa dang kun 'byung gis thob pa dang 'gog pas thob pa dang lam gyis thob pa dang bsgom pas spang bar bya'o //
translated: Again, the conditioned is to be attained through suffering, to be attained through origin, to be attained through cessation, to be attained through the path, and to be abandoned through cultivation.

original: 'dus ma byas ni spang bya ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni spang bya ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is only not to be abandoned.

original: yang 'dus byas ni /
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni /
translated: Again, the conditioned is:

original: gzugs kyi phung pos kun tu bsdus pa dang / tshor ba'i phung pos kun du bsdus pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung pos kun du bsdus pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung pos kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung pos kun du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung pos kun tu bsdus pa dang / tshor ba'i phung pos kun du bsdus pa dang / 'du shes kyi phung pos kun du bsdus pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung pos kun du bsdus pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung pos kun du bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the aggregate of form, the aggregate of feeling, the aggregate of perception, the aggregate of volitional factors, and the aggregate of consciousness.

original: 'dus ma byas ni phung pos bsdus pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni phung pos bsdus pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is not included in the aggregates at all.

original: yang 'dus byas ni ;
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni ;
translated: Moreover, the conditioned is

original: mig gi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / rna ba'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / sna'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / lce'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / lus kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / rna ba'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / sna'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / lce'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / lus kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang /
translated: included in the sense-sphere of the eye, the sense-sphere of the ear, the sense-sphere of the nose, the sense-sphere of the tongue, the sense-sphere of the body,

original: yid kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / gzugs kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / sgra'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / dri'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / ro'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / gzugs kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / sgra'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / dri'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / ro'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang /
translated: the mental sense source, the form sense source, the sound sense source, the smell sense source, the taste sense source, and the tangible object sense source.üîΩ

original: reg pa'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / chos kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa'o //üîΩ'dus ma byas ni chos kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: reg pa'i skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa dang / chos kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa'o // 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi skye mched kyis kun du bsdus pa kho na'o //
translated: The mental faculty is included in the mental faculty base, the form base, the sound base, the smell base, the taste base, the tangible-object base, and the entity base.

original: yang 'dus byas ni /
analyzed: yang 'dus byas ni /
translated: The unconditioned is included in the entity base alone.

original: mig gi khams kyis kun du bsdus pa nas /
analyzed: mig gi khams kyis kun du bsdus pa nas /
translated: The conditioned is included in the eye element,

original: yid kyi khams kyi bar du kun du bsdus pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa nas /
analyzed: yid kyi khams kyi bar du kun du bsdus pa dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis bsdus pa nas /
translated: up to the mental faculty element, the eye-consciousness element,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du kun du bsdus pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyis bsdus pa nas /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du kun du bsdus pa dang / gzugs kyi khams kyis bsdus pa nas /
translated: up to the mental-consciousness element, and the form element,

original: chos kyi khams kyi bar gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi khams kyi bar gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: up to the entity element.

original: 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi khams kyis kun du bsdus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni chos kyi khams kyis kun du bsdus pa kho na'o //
translated: The unconditioned is included in the phenomena element alone.

original: de la gzhung du 'chad par 'gyur ba gang 'gog pa'i bden pas kun du bsdus pa'i chos rnams dang nam mkha' ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
analyzed: de la gzhung du 'chad par 'gyur ba gang 'gog pa'i bden pas kun du bsdus pa'i chos rnams dang nam mkha' ni 'dus ma byas kyi chos so //
translated: The unconditioned is the phenomena that are included in the truth of cessation, which will be explained later, and space.

original: chos gzhan thams cad @110a * //
analyzed: chos gzhan thams cad @110a * //
translated: All other phenomena

original: ni 'dus byas so //
analyzed: ni 'dus byas so //
translated: are conditioned.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it says:

original: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang ni 'gog pa gnyis //
translated: Space and the two cessations

original: 'di gsum rtag cing 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: 'di gsum rtag cing 'dus ma byas //
translated: are the three that are permanent and unconditioned.

original: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad skad cig ma //
translated: All conditioned phenomena are momentary.

original: bdag gis stong zhing byed po med //
analyzed: bdag gis stong zhing byed po med //
translated: They are empty of self and have no creator.

original: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par dbye ba nges pa zhes bya ba le'u dang po'o /
analyzed: pandi ta chen po stobs bcu dpal bshes gnyen gyis bsdus pa 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par nges pa las 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas rnam par dbye ba nges pa zhes bya ba le'u dang po'o /
translated: This concludes the first chapter, the chapter on the ascertainment of the conditioned and the unconditioned, from this Ornament of Ascertainment of the Conditioned and the Unconditioned.

original: // / de la 'di gsum ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'dus byas te /
analyzed: // / de la 'di gsum ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid 'dus byas te /
translated: The three characteristics of the conditioned are the conditioned itself:

original: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / gnas pa dang / mi rtag pa'o //
translated: arising, enduring, and impermanence.

original: 'di rnams su rgas pa bsdus pas bzhi ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces kha cig go //
analyzed: 'di rnams su rgas pa bsdus pas bzhi ni 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid ces kha cig go //
translated: Some believe that these four are the characteristics of the conditioned because the conditioned is included in these.

original: 'dus byas ni 'di bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rgyu ni drug ste /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni 'di bskyed par bya ba'i phyir rgyu ni drug ste /
translated: The cause of the conditioned is sixfold in order to generate the conditioned.

original: byed pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu dang / lhan cig 'byung ba'i rgyu dang / skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i rgyu dang / rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The efficient cause, the simultaneous cause, the homogeneous cause, the associated cause, the universal cause and the retributive cause.

original: rgyu de rnams kyis khyad par ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ni gcig ste /
analyzed: rgyu de rnams kyis khyad par ma yin pa'i 'bras bu ni gcig ste /
translated: The effect of the cause that is not a specific effect is one.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that?

original: 'dus byas thams cad do //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad do //
translated: It is all the conditioned.

original: khyad par ni 'bras bu bzhi ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: khyad par ni 'bras bu bzhi ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The specific effect is fourfold.üîΩWhat are the four?

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i 'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i 'o //
translated: The effect of the retributive cause is the effect of retribution.

original: byed pa'i rgyu'i ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i rgyu'i ni bdag po'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The effect of the efficient cause is the effect of dominance.

original: skal ba ma nyam pa dang thams cad du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi ni rgyu mthun gyi 'bras bu'o//
analyzed: skal ba ma nyam pa dang thams cad du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag gi ni rgyu mthun gyi 'bras bu'o//
translated: The effect of the homogeneous cause and the universal cause is the effect of equal outflow.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu dag gi ni skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The co-existent cause and the associated cause have the effect of human action.

original: rkyen bzhi'o // 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rkyen bzhi'o // 'di lta ste /
translated: There are four conditions:

original: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu'i rkyen dang / de ma thag pa'i rkyen dang / dmigs pa'i rkyen dang / bdag po'i rkyen rnams so //
translated: the causal condition, the homogeneous immediate condition, the condition of object, and the dominant condition.

original: de la chos 'dus byas kyi bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo las gzhan chos thams cad ni byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: de la chos 'dus byas kyi bdag nyid rang gi ngo bo las gzhan chos thams cad ni byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The causal condition is all dharmas other than the effect itself, which is of the nature of a conditioned dharma.

original: skye ba rnams la gegs med pa'i ngo bos rnam par gnas pas so //üîΩgang chos phan tshun 'bras bur gyur pa de ni phan tshun lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: skye ba rnams la gegs med pa'i ngo bos rnam par gnas pas so // gang chos phan tshun 'bras bur gyur pa de ni phan tshun lhan cig tu 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: It is a condition by the nature of not obstructing the arising of dharmas.üîΩThe homogeneous immediate condition is the preceding mind and mental factors that are immediately followed by the arising of the mind and mental factors.üîΩThe condition of object is all dharmas.üîΩThe dominant condition is all dharmas other than the effect itself.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The effect of human action is the effect of the co-existent cause and the associated cause.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
translated: The effect of dominance is the effect of the causal condition.üîΩThe effect of human action is the effect of the homogeneous immediate condition.

original: sngon goms par byas pa 'dra ba'i chos phyi ma 'dra ba rgyas pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin par skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: sngon goms par byas pa 'dra ba'i chos phyi ma 'dra ba rgyas pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin par skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu'o //üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: The effect of dominance is the effect of the condition of object and the dominant condition.

original: dge ba'i phung po lnga las dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can las nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa las lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phung po lnga las dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa can las nyon mongs pa can dang / lung du ma bstan pa las lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The simultaneous cause is the cause of the factors that are simultaneous.

original: gang chos ngo bo lhan cig tu dmigs pa kun du grub pa ste /
analyzed: gang chos ngo bo lhan cig tu dmigs pa kun du grub pa ste /
translated: The factors that are simultaneous and that are always found together are the simultaneous cause.üîΩThe mind and the mental factors are simultaneous and always found together.

original: yang gang rung ma tshangs @110b bas ni ma yin pa de ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang gang rung ma tshangs @110b bas ni ma yin pa de ni mtshungs par ldan pa'i rgyu ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The factors that are simultaneous and that are not always found together are not the simultaneous cause.üîΩThe primary elements and the derived matter are simultaneous and are not always found together.üîΩThe derived matter is not the simultaneous cause of the primary elements.üîΩThe primary elements are not the simultaneous cause of the derived matter.üîΩThe primary elements are not the simultaneous cause of the other primary elements.üîΩThe derived matter is not the simultaneous cause of the other derived matter.üîΩThe primary elements are the simultaneous cause of the derived matter.üîΩThe derived matter is the simultaneous cause of the derived matter.üîΩThe primary elements are the simultaneous cause of the primary elements.üîΩThe primary elements and the derived matter are the simultaneous cause of the mind and the mental factors.üîΩThe mind and the mental factors are the simultaneous cause of the mind and the mental factors.üîΩThe mind and the mental factors are the simultaneous cause of the derived matter.üîΩThe derived matter is the simultaneous cause of the derived matter.üîΩThe derived matter is the simultaneous cause of the mind and the mental factors.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'o //

ignorance,

translated: This is the end of the increase.

original: de la yar 'phel rtse mor byin pa'i mi rnams kyi khyim ni dpal mo bzhin du 'phel ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la yar 'phel rtse mor byin pa'i mi rnams kyi khyim ni dpal mo bzhin du 'phel ba nyid do //
translated: The houses of the humans who have reached the peak of the increase are filled with prosperity.

original: bu mo lo lnga brgya na khyo la gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu mo lo lnga brgya na khyo la gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The girl will be given to a husband after five hundred years.

original: mi de rnams tshe lo dang mthun pa 'byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa legs par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i tshe khyim bya'i brjod pa'i yul mi rnams kyi gnas sa gzhi @133a * //
analyzed: mi de rnams tshe lo dang mthun pa 'byung ba'i gzugs la sogs pa legs par 'byung bar 'gyur ro // de'i tshe khyim bya'i brjod pa'i yul mi rnams kyi gnas sa gzhi @133a * //
translated: Those people will have bodies and so on that accord with their lifespans.

original: ma lus pa grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa yongs su gang bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma lus pa grong dang grong khyer la sogs pa yongs su gang bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the land will be filled with villages, cities, and so on, and will be the domain of the speech of the house sparrow.

original: sa chen pos mi gtsang ba 'og tu byung ste gtsang sbra can 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa chen pos mi gtsang ba 'og tu byung ste gtsang sbra can 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The great earth will produce filth, and those who are clean will appear.

original: mi rnams bde ba dang lhan cig pa'i phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par tshim par 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal dran par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rnams bde ba dang lhan cig pa'i phun sum tshogs pas yang dag par tshim par 'gyur zhing sdug bsngal dran par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: People will be satisfied with perfect abundance together with happiness and will not remember suffering.

original: bsil dro la sogs pa bkres rgas yongs su longs spyod pa rnams 'dod pa tsam byed pa ste /
analyzed: bsil dro la sogs pa bkres rgas yongs su longs spyod pa rnams 'dod pa tsam byed pa ste /
translated: They will enjoy cool and warm temperatures, food, and so on, and will do only what they want.

original: sdug bsngal yin yang de'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi tha snyad tsam mo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin yang de'i tshe sdug bsngal gyi tha snyad tsam mo //
translated: Even though it is suffering, at that time it will be merely called suffering.

original: 'di ni mi rnams yar 'phel chen po thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rnams yar 'phel chen po thob pa ste /
translated: This is the great increase of humans.

original: lo stong dang dpag tu med pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong dang dpag tu med pa 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The lifespan increases up to 80,000 years.

original: yang de nas yar 'phel chen mo nas mi rnams kyi tshe nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang de nas yar 'phel chen mo nas mi rnams kyi tshe nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, after the great increase, the lifespan of humans decreases.

original: de nas mi rnams chos ma yin pas ches nyams pas yang sngon bzhin du tshe lo bcu pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mi rnams chos ma yin pas ches nyams pas yang sngon bzhin du tshe lo bcu pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, due to the degeneration of the Dharma, the lifespan again becomes ten years as before.

original: de'i tshe yang bskal pa bcu bar rgyab tu gyur pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang bskal pa bcu bar rgyab tu gyur pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the ten intermediate kalpas that are behind us will have passed.

original: ci ltar bskal pa bcu pa thog mtha' bde sdug ldan pa de bzhin du gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba bskal pa bcu rnams so sor thog mtha' bde sdug ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ltar bskal pa bcu pa thog mtha' bde sdug ldan pa de bzhin du gzhan yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba bskal pa bcu rnams so sor thog mtha' bde sdug ldan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the first and last of the ten kalpas are pleasant and unpleasant, so too the other ten kalpas will occur.

original: des na nyi ma shar ba nas bzung ste /
analyzed: des na nyi ma shar ba nas bzung ste /
translated: Thus, from the time the sun arises,

original: bskal pa nyi shu ni chags pa'i 'jig rten gnas pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa nyi shu ni chags pa'i 'jig rten gnas pa'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: twenty kalpas have passed since the formation of the world.

original: 'chags pa'i bskal pa nyi shu'i tha ma la bar gyi 'jig pa gsum gyi de ma thag tu lhag ma lus pa'i mi rnams phan tshun dga' ba'i bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chags pa'i bskal pa nyi shu'i tha ma la bar gyi 'jig pa gsum gyi de ma thag tu lhag ma lus pa'i mi rnams phan tshun dga' ba'i bsam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At the end of the twenty periods of creation, immediately after the three destructions, the remaining humans have thoughts of affection for one another.

original: de'i tshe byams pas nye bar bsags pa'i las dbang las phyi rol gyi dngos po yang ches nyams dga' bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe byams pas nye bar bsags pa'i las dbang las phyi rol gyi dngos po yang ches nyams dga' bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, by the power of actions accumulated through loving-kindness, external things also appear very delightful.

original: byams pas kun du bskyed pa'i phun sum tshogs pa me'i dus las sngon du nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byams pas kun du bskyed pa'i phun sum tshogs pa me'i dus las sngon du nyams su myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The perfection produced by loving-kindness is experienced before the time of fire.

original: ngan 'gro'i sems can rnams kyang phan tshun byams pa chen po bskrun te /
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i sems can rnams kyang phan tshun byams pa chen po bskrun te /
translated: Even the sentient beings of the unfortunate planes of existence develop great affection for one another.

original: kha cig lha rnams su nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig lha rnams su nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some are reborn among the gods.

original: de'i tshe 'chad par byed pa'i mi mu stegs kyi tshogs kyis sam /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'chad par byed pa'i mi mu stegs kyi tshogs kyis sam /
translated: At that time, a human teacher, or a group of non-Buddhists,

original: 'od gsal gyi lha yang smra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha yang smra bar 'gyur te /
translated: or even a god of the clear light realm, will speak.

original: chos kyi rgyal po skyes bu bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi rgyal po skyes bu bzhin no //
translated: Like a king of the Dharma, a person.

original: de las chos thos te 'dod pa la rnam par smad de dga' ba dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa yang dag par bskyed de /
analyzed: de las chos thos te 'dod pa la rnam par smad de dga' ba dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan gnyis pa yang dag par bskyed de /
translated: Having heard the Dharma from them, he condemns desire and generates the second concentration endowed with joy and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa las gzhan ting nge 'dzin rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa las gzhan ting nge 'dzin rnam par spangs te /
translated: Having abandoned the concentration of the second concentration,

original: lha'i ris de nyid du 'od gsal du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i ris de nyid du 'od gsal du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: he goes to the clear light of that very class of gods.

original: 'di ni bskal pa bcus stong gi 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams 'jig rten @133b par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bskal pa bcus stong gi 'jig rten gyi sems can rnams 'jig rten @133b par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This is the destruction of the world of sentient beings by ten eons.

original: de'i rjes su bskal pa phyed dang bcas pa'i gcig tu snod kyi 'jig rten stong par ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su bskal pa phyed dang bcas pa'i gcig tu snod kyi 'jig rten stong par ro //
translated: After that, for one eon and a half, the external world remains empty.

original: lha rnams char 'bebs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha rnams char 'bebs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods do not rain.

original: de'i tshe shing gel ba nyal stong la sogs pa yongs su skams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe shing gel ba nyal stong la sogs pa yongs su skams par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the trees, vines, and so on completely dry up.

original: de rjes su sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i ris su nyi ma gnyis pa sngon ma'i gnyis 'gyur gyi tshad kun du shar te 'og tu ma lus pa sreg pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis so //
analyzed: de rjes su sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i lha'i ris su nyi ma gnyis pa sngon ma'i gnyis 'gyur gyi tshad kun du shar te 'og tu ma lus pa sreg pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis so //
translated: Then, in the heaven of the Thirty-three gods, a second sun appears, twice as hot as the first, and burns everything below, in one half-kalpa.

original: de'i tshe 'bab chu la sogs pa chu bzhi thams cad skams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'bab chu la sogs pa chu bzhi thams cad skams par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, all the four rivers, the Ganges, etc., dry up.

original: de rjes su 'thab bral lha'i rtse mo ru nyi ma gsum pa nyi ma gnyis pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad 'og tu sreg pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis so //
analyzed: de rjes su 'thab bral lha'i rtse mo ru nyi ma gsum pa nyi ma gnyis pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad 'og tu sreg pa ni phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis so //
translated: Then, in the heaven of YƒÅma gods, a third sun appears, twice as hot as the second, and burns everything below, in one half-kalpa.

original: de'i tshe mtsho chen po ma dros pa la sogs pa yongs su skams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mtsho chen po ma dros pa la sogs pa yongs su skams par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the great lake Anavatapta dries up completely.

original: de'i rjes su nyi ma bzhi pa nyi ma gsum pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad dga' ldan gyi rtse mo ru kun du shar te phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis 'og tu sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su nyi ma bzhi pa nyi ma gsum pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad dga' ldan gyi rtse mo ru kun du shar te phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis 'og tu sreg par byed do //
translated: Then, in the heaven of Tu·π£ita gods, a fourth sun appears, twice as hot as the third, and burns everything below, in one half-kalpa.

original: de'i tshe chu bo chen po bdun rnam par skams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe chu bo chen po bdun rnam par skams par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the seven great rivers dry up completely.

original: de'i rjes su nyi ma lnga pa nyi ma bzhi pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad 'phrul dga'i rtse mo ru kun du shar te phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis 'og tu sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su nyi ma lnga pa nyi ma bzhi pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad 'phrul dga'i rtse mo ru kun du shar te phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis 'og tu sreg par byed do //
translated: After that, the fifth sun appears on the peak of the Heaven of Delighting in Emanations, twice the size of the fourth sun, and in half an eon it burns below.

original: de'i tshe rgya mtsho chen po thams cad lhag ma dang bcas pa rnam par skams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgya mtsho chen po thams cad lhag ma dang bcas pa rnam par skams par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, all the great oceans dry up completely,

original: rim gyis gan rgyal gyi lus su 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis gan rgyal gyi lus su 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and gradually the earth appears as if turned over.

original: de'i rjes su nyi ma drug pa nyi ma lnga pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi rtse la kun du shar te phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis 'og tu sreg par byed do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su nyi ma drug pa nyi ma lnga pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi rtse la kun du shar te phyed dang bcas pa'i bskal pa gcig gis 'og tu sreg par byed do //
translated: After that, the sixth sun appears on the peak of the Heaven of Controlling Others' Emanations, twice the size of the fifth sun, and in half an eon it burns below.

original: de'i tshe ri rab la sogs pa'i ri rnams dang sa chen po rnams las du ba 'thul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ri rab la sogs pa'i ri rnams dang sa chen po rnams las du ba 'thul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, smoke rises from Mount Meru and the great earth.

original: de'i rjes su nyi ma bdun pa nyi ma drug pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad bsam gtan dang po'i rtse mo la shar te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su nyi ma bdun pa nyi ma drug pa'i nyis 'gyur gyi tshad bsam gtan dang po'i rtse mo la shar te /
translated: After that, the seventh sun rises, twice the size of the sixth sun, and it burns the peak of the first absorption.

original: bskal pa gcig gis 'og tu thams cad lhag ma dang bcas pa sreg par byed do //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig gis 'og tu thams cad lhag ma dang bcas pa sreg par byed do //
translated: In one eon it burns all below it, leaving nothing behind.

original: de'i tshe bsam gtan dang po'i bar du thal ba'i lhag ma yang ma lus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bsam gtan dang po'i bar du thal ba'i lhag ma yang ma lus par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, even the ashes of the first absorption are completely destroyed.

original: de ltar thams cad bsregs te rang nyid kyis nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar thams cad bsregs te rang nyid kyis nye bar zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, after everything is burned, it is pacified by itself.

original: bud shing ma tshang ba'i me bzhin no //
analyzed: bud shing ma tshang ba'i me bzhin no //
translated: It is like a fire that lacks fuel.

original: dus gcig tu stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gcig tu stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: At one time, the world systems of a billion universes are destroyed.

original: me chu rlung gi 'jig pa gsum ni bar chad med par @134a * //
analyzed: me chu rlung gi 'jig pa gsum ni bar chad med par @134a * //
translated: The three destructions by fire, water, and wind occur without interruption.

original: rim gyis gsum ka 'byung ba'i nges pa med de /üîΩme'i 'jig pa 'byung ba'i tshe chu rlung gi 'jig pa mi 'byung la /
analyzed: rim gyis gsum ka 'byung ba'i nges pa med de / me'i 'jig pa 'byung ba'i tshe chu rlung gi 'jig pa mi 'byung la /
translated: There is no certainty that all three occur in sequence.üîΩWhen destruction by fire occurs, destruction by water and wind do not occur.

original: chus 'jig pa na me rlung gi 'jig pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chus 'jig pa na me rlung gi 'jig pa mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When destruction by water occurs, destruction by fire and wind do not occur.

original: de bzhin du rlung yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rlung yang ngo //
translated: The same applies to destruction by wind.

original: 'jig pa re re la bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa re re la bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu'o //
translated: Each of these destructions lasts twenty small aeons.

original: des na bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu 'jig pa'i bskal pa chen po'o //
analyzed: des na bar gyi bskal pa nyi shu 'jig pa'i bskal pa chen po'o //
translated: Thus twenty small aeons make a great aeon of destruction.

original: de bzhin du gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsungs te /
translated: The same text says:

original: tshangs pa gcig pu bskal pa bcu ru gnas //
analyzed: tshangs pa gcig pu bskal pa bcu ru gnas //
translated: Brahma remains for ten aeons;

original: de yi 'khor gnas bskal pa gcig gis bzhengs //
analyzed: de yi 'khor gnas bskal pa gcig gis bzhengs //
translated: his retinue remains for one aeon.

original: tshangs ris nas ni 'thab bral mthar thug pa //
analyzed: tshangs ris nas ni 'thab bral mthar thug pa //
translated: From the Brahma world to the Yama heaven,

original: so sor bskal pa re res 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: so sor bskal pa re res 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: each arises in one aeon.

original: sa gzhi ri sogs bskal pa gcig gis bzhengs //
analyzed: sa gzhi ri sogs bskal pa gcig gis bzhengs //
translated: The earth, mountains, and so forth arise in one aeon.

original: rang nyid 'od zer bskal pa gnyis kyis bzhengs //
analyzed: rang nyid 'od zer bskal pa gnyis kyis bzhengs //
translated: The light of the sun and moon arises in two aeons.

original: nyi ma shar ba la ni rab tu reg /'di ltar 'chags bzhin pa ste nyi shu'o //
analyzed: nyi ma shar ba la ni rab tu reg /'di ltar 'chags bzhin pa ste nyi shu'o //
translated: The sun and moon shine and touch the earth; thus twenty aeons have passed since the creation of the world.

original: sa yi zhag dang khur ba tshal dang ni //üîΩs'a lu 'bras te 'di rnams bde gnas ni //
analyzed: sa yi zhag dang khur ba tshal dang ni // s'a lu 'bras te 'di rnams bde gnas ni //
translated: The earth, the food of distillation, the forest,üîΩthe rice, and the barley are the eight abodes of happiness.

original: brgyad de gzhan yang thog mtha' bde sdug 'gyur //
analyzed: brgyad de gzhan yang thog mtha' bde sdug 'gyur //
translated: The other abodes are of suffering and happiness.

original: spun ma byung ba la sogs bcu gnyis ni //
analyzed: spun ma byung ba la sogs bcu gnyis ni //
translated: The twelve abodes of suffering are the absence of brothers and so forth.

original: 'di rnams chags nas 'jig pa nyi shu'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams chags nas 'jig pa nyi shu'o //
translated: These are the twenty aeons of destruction.

original: de nas bskal pa bcu yis sems can rnams //
analyzed: de nas bskal pa bcu yis sems can rnams //
translated: Then, after ten eons, the sentient beings

original: bde ba ldan par kun du 'jig par 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba ldan par kun du 'jig par 'gyur //
translated: are all destroyed, along with their happiness.

original: de nas phyed bcas bskal par char med do //
analyzed: de nas phyed bcas bskal par char med do //
translated: Then, for a half eon, there is no rain.

original: de nas gzhan du nyi ma lnga rnams la //
analyzed: de nas gzhan du nyi ma lnga rnams la //
translated: Then, for five more days,

original: so so la ni bskal pa gcig dang phyed //
analyzed: so so la ni bskal pa gcig dang phyed //
translated: each day a half eon.

original: rtse la shar te 'og tu sreg par byed //
analyzed: rtse la shar te 'og tu sreg par byed //
translated: The sun, rising in the east, burns the lower regions.

original: bskal pa gcig gis bskal pa bdun pa yi //
analyzed: bskal pa gcig gis bskal pa bdun pa yi //
translated: In one eon, seven eons pass,

original: thams cad sreg par byed de nyi shu'o //üîΩkun du 'jig par 'gyur te 'di rnams ni //
analyzed: thams cad sreg par byed de nyi shu'o // kun du 'jig par 'gyur te 'di rnams ni //
translated: and all is burned for twenty eons.

original: des na 'jig pa'i bskal pa nyi shu nyid //
analyzed: des na 'jig pa'i bskal pa nyi shu nyid //
translated: This is the period of destruction.

original: de'i rjes su de ltar gnas rnams stong pa nam mkha' tsam du bskal pa nyi shu nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su de ltar gnas rnams stong pa nam mkha' tsam du bskal pa nyi shu nyid du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, after that, the empty abodes remain as mere space for twenty eons.

original: de nas yang sngon bzhin du 'chags pa la sogs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de nas yang sngon bzhin du 'chags pa la sogs pa thams cad do //
translated: Then, again, all the creations and so forth occur as before.

original: de rjes su 'ga' zhig gi tshe bsam gtan gnyis na gnas pa'i sems can rnams dga' ba dang bcas pa don gyi 'dod pa sun phyung ste /
analyzed: de rjes su 'ga' zhig gi tshe bsam gtan gnyis na gnas pa'i sems can rnams dga' ba dang bcas pa don gyi 'dod pa sun phyung ste /
translated: Then, after that, some sentient beings who are abiding in the second absorption, having become disgusted with the pleasures of the desire realm,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa yang dag par bskyed de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa yang dag par bskyed de /
translated: Then, after the third concentration has arisen,

original: de nas 'phos te bsam gtan gsum par kun du skye'o //
analyzed: de nas 'phos te bsam gtan gsum par kun du skye'o //
translated: they move and are born in the third concentration.

original: de rjes su de ru zla ba bdun 'char bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rjes su de ru zla ba bdun 'char bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After that, seven moons arise there.

original: zla ba shar ba'i rkyen gyis chu kun du 'khor bar rab tu 'phel te /
analyzed: zla ba shar ba'i rkyen gyis chu kun du 'khor bar rab tu 'phel te /
translated: Due to the condition of the moons arising, the water increases and overflows,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa khor yug tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa khor yug tu nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the second concentration is destroyed.

original: de rjes su bde ba dang bcas pa'i @134b 'dod pa ni skyon mang ba snang ba zhes rig ste /
analyzed: de rjes su bde ba dang bcas pa'i @134b 'dod pa ni skyon mang ba snang ba zhes rig ste /
translated: After that, the gods of the third concentration see the many faults of the second concentration, which is associated with pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa gnas pa'i sems can rnams bsam gtan bzhi pa yang dag par bskyed de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa gnas pa'i sems can rnams bsam gtan bzhi pa yang dag par bskyed de /
translated: They generate the fourth concentration.

original: de'i rkyen gyis yang bsam gtan gsum pa nas 'phos te /
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis yang bsam gtan gsum pa nas 'phos te /
translated: Due to that condition, they move from the third concentration

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa 'jig pa'i rtse mo 'bras bu che ba zhes pa'i lha'i ris su kun du nye bar skye'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa 'jig pa'i rtse mo 'bras bu che ba zhes pa'i lha'i ris su kun du nye bar skye'o //
translated: and are born in the highest peak of existence, the gods of great fruit.

original: de'i tshe snod kyi 'jig rten ma lus par zhig par gyur pa na /
analyzed: de'i tshe snod kyi 'jig rten ma lus par zhig par gyur pa na /
translated: At that time, when the entire physical cosmos is destroyed,

original: shin tu dag pa'i rlung kun du 'khor bar rab tu rgyu'o //
analyzed: shin tu dag pa'i rlung kun du 'khor bar rab tu rgyu'o //

analyzed: de dang bar med par bskal pa snying po zhes pa la klu'i rgyal po mnyam med du gyur pas sangs rgyas rnam par gzigs mnyes par byas so //

analyzed: de dang bar med par bskal pa sum cu rtsa gcig tu sangs rgyas med pa'i ngan 'gror 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ma thag tu snying po mchog gi bskal pa la rgyal po dgu 'dul du gyur pas sangs rgyas gtsug tor can mnyes par byas so //

translated: Then, as King Beautiful to Behold, he pleased Buddha Vipa≈õyin.

analyzed: de ma thag tu bskal pa bzang po la rgyal po bzod par gyur pas sangs rgyas 'khor ba 'jig mnyes par byas so //

original: rgyal po ri bo zhes par gyur pas /
analyzed: rgyal po ri bo zhes par gyur pas /
translated: Then, as King Mountain,

original: sangs rgyas gser thub mnyes par byas so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gser thub mnyes par byas so //

analyzed: de'i rjes su dpal gzhon nu don thams cad grub par gyur pas rang nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mngon du mdzad de /
translated: Immediately after that, he became Glorious Youthful SiddhipƒÅda and actualized omniscience himself.

analyzed: sh'akya thub pa zhes pa'i ming can sangs rgyas su @138a * //

analyzed: gyur to // da ni de ma thag tu dus mi ring bar byang chub sems dpa' byams pa rgyal ba mi pham pa zhes bya ba'i sangs rgyas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After him, not long after, the Bodhisattva Maitreya will appear, who will be the Buddha called Ajita.

original: bdag cag gi ston pa 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa ni de lta bu'o //üîΩgzhan gyi ni gzhan du ste //
analyzed: bdag cag gi ston pa 'di'i rnam par gzhag pa ni de lta bu'o // gzhan gyi ni gzhan du ste //

analyzed: yang gzhan rnams ni gzhan du rig par bya'o // 'di lta ste /

original: gang zag ni gsum ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zag ni gsum ste / 'di lta ste /

analyzed: lhag pa'i dad pa can dang / lhag pa'i brtson 'grus can dang / lhag pa'i shes rab can no //

analyzed: de la lhag pa'i dad pa can ni go bar nges par 'gyur ba yin no //

analyzed: lhag pa'i brtson 'grus can ni rnam par spros pas go bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab can ni mgo smos pas go bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de la lhag pa'i dad pa can ni lung bstan pa thob pa nas bzung ste /

analyzed: shes rab lhag pa can ni lung bstan thob pa nas bzung ste /

original: bskal pa stong phrag brgya lhag pa'i bskal pa grangs med bzhis thams cad mkhyen pa mngon du byed do zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bskal pa stong phrag brgya lhag pa'i bskal pa grangs med bzhis thams cad mkhyen pa mngon du byed do zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar yang bskal pa grangs med dang bos tshogs kyis nas brtsams te ci srid du sa dang po rdzogs par 'gyur ro //

original: yang don dam par ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //

analyzed: de rjes su mos pas @138b spyod pa'i sa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ni bskal pa grangs med gnyis 'da'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis kun du bzang po sgrub par byed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ltar bskal pa grangs med sum cu rtsa gsum gyis sangs rgyas nyid thob po zhes zer ro //

analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba yang / skye bo rnams tshe lo stong phrag brgyad cu las 'grib pa nas brtsams te /

analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pas ni dge ba'i phyogs rgud par byed do //

analyzed: glang po che nag po dang / glang po che dmar ser dang / glang po che dmar skya dang / zangs kyi glang po che dang / glang po che ser skya'i rigs dang / spos kyi glang po'i rigs dang / glang po che bkra shis kyi rigs dang /

analyzed: glang po che gser gyi rigs dang / glang po che gso sbyong 'phags kyi rigs dang / glang po che mche ba drug ldan gyi rigs so //

analyzed: glang po che mche ba drug ldan gyi rigs stong phrag dgu'i stobs ni srid pa tha ma'i byang chub sems dpa' stobs kyi glang po stong phrag dgu'i stobs zhes brjod do // rta'i rigs ni bzhi'o //

original: 'di lta ste //
analyzed: 'di lta ste //

analyzed: ba da'i rta'i rigs dang / rnam par smin pa'i rta'i rigs dang / cad shes kyi rta'i rigs dang / sprin gyi shugs can gyi rta'i rigs so zhes so //
translated: the horse of the Bada type, the horse of the VipƒÅka type, the horse of the Chedaka type, and the horse of the Meghajava type.

analyzed: kha cig tu gling bzhi dbang phyug gi 'khor los sgyur ba 'ga' zhig lha'i 'jig rten du 'gro bar yang 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //

analyzed: lha'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba'i 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po de yang rnam pa drug ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /

original: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga dang / yul lnga'o //
translated: the five sense faculties and the five sense objects.

original: sgra la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sgra la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Sound has two aspects:

original: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba dang / ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: that which arises from the cause of the appropriated great elements and that which arises from the cause of the non-appropriated great elements.

original: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: That which arises from the cause of the appropriated great elements is twofold:

original: sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin no //
translated: that which is indicative of sentient beings and that which is not indicative of sentient beings.

original: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ma zin pa'i 'byung ba chen po'i rgyu las byung ba la rnam pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: That which arises from the cause of the non-appropriated great elements is also twofold:

original: sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du ston pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: that which is indicative of sentient beings and that which is not indicative of sentient beings.

original: yang bzhi po 'di rnams la so sor yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: yang bzhi po 'di rnams la so sor yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i dbye bas rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: These four types of objects are divided into eight types, pleasant and unpleasant.

original: dri la rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: dri la rnam pa gsum ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Smells are of three types:

original: dri bzang po dang / dri ngan pa dang / dri mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: dri bzang po dang / dri ngan pa dang / dri mnyam pa'o //
translated: pleasant, unpleasant, and neutral.

original: ro la drug ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ro la drug ste 'di lta ste /
translated: Tastes are of six types:

original: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mngar ba dang / skyur ba dang / lan tshva dang / tsha ba dang / kha ba dang / bsngal ba'o //
translated: sweet, sour, salty, pungent, bitter, and astringent.

original: reg bya rnam pa bcu gcig ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: reg bya rnam pa bcu gcig ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Tangible objects are of eleven types:

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / lci ba dang / yang ba dang / bsil ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung dang / 'jam pa dang / rtsub pa dang / lci ba dang / yang ba dang / bsil ba dang / bkres pa dang / skom pa'o //
translated: earth, water, fire, air, softness, roughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs la rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i gzugs la rnam pa gsum ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
translated: Non-revealing form is of three types:üîΩthe morality of abandoning the seven types of unwholesome actions,

original: sdom pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gzugs dang / sdom pa ma yin pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gzugs dang / sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gzugs so //
analyzed: sdom pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gzugs dang / sdom pa ma yin pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gzugs dang / sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i gzugs so //
translated: form associated with the moral precepts, form associated with immorality, and form associated with neither.

original: tshor ba'i phung po la rnam pa gnyis te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshor ba'i phung po la rnam pa gnyis te 'di lta ste /
translated: The aggregate of feeling is twofold:

original: lus las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sems las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: lus las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / sems las byung ba'i tshor ba'o //
translated: feeling born of contact with the body and feeling born of contact with thought.

original: de la lus las byung ba'i tshor ba lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lus las byung ba'i tshor ba lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The five feelings born of contact with the body are

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i 'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i tshor ba dang / rna ba'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i dang / sna'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las byung ba'i dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i 'o //
translated: feeling born of contact with the eye, feeling born of contact with the ear, feeling born of contact with the nose, feeling born of contact with the tongue, and feeling born of contact with the body.

original: yid kyi ni gcig ste /
analyzed: yid kyi ni gcig ste /
translated: The sixth is feeling born of contact with thought.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is

original: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen las skyes pa'i tshor ba'o //
translated: feeling born of contact with the mind.

original: des na tshor ba drug tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na tshor ba drug tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus there are six feelings.

original: @141b yang tshor ba de rnams so sor rnam pa gsum du phye bas bco brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: @141b yang tshor ba de rnams so sor rnam pa gsum du phye bas bco brgyad du 'gyur ba yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: These feelings are divided into eighteen by distinguishing their aspects.üîΩWhat are the eighteen?

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal ma yin pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa'o //üîΩyang rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / sdug bsngal ma yin pa dang / bde ba ma yin pa'o // yang rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: They are pleasant, unpleasant, neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There are five other feelings:

original: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o //üîΩ'du shes kyi phung po la drug ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po'o // 'du shes kyi phung po la drug ste /
translated: the faculty of pleasure, the faculty of pain, the faculty of mental pleasure, the faculty of mental displeasure, and the faculty of indifference.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The aggregate of perception is sixfold:

original: mig gi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes dang / rna ba'i rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dang / sna'i rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dang / lce'i rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dang / lus kyi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dang /
analyzed: mig gi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du shes dang / rna ba'i rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dang / sna'i rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dang / lce'i rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dang / lus kyi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i dang /
translated: The discernment associated with the eye consciousness, the discernment associated with the ear consciousness, the discernment associated with the nose consciousness, the discernment associated with the tongue consciousness, the discernment associated with the body consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'o //üîΩyang so sor rnam pa gsum du phye bas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'o // yang so sor rnam pa gsum du phye bas 'di lta ste /
translated: and the discernment associated with the mental consciousness.üîΩMoreover, each of these is divided into three types, making eighteen in all:

original: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa ste zhes bya ba bco brgyad du 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chen por gyur pa dang / tshad med pa ste zhes bya ba bco brgyad du 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: small, medium, and great.

original: 'du byed kyi phung po ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi phung po ni rnam pa gnyis te 'di lta ste /
translated: The formation aggregate is twofold:

original: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed do //
analyzed: sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i 'du byed dang / sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed do //
translated: the formations associated with the mind and the formations not associated with the mind.

original: de la sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mdor bsdu na chos bzhi bcu ste /
analyzed: de la sems dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i mdor bsdu na chos bzhi bcu ste /
translated: The formations associated with the mind are, in brief, forty mental factors.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: sems pa dang / reg pa dang / yid la byed pa dang / 'dun pa dang / mos pa dang / dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: mind, contact, attention, aspiration, resolution, faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, conception,

original: rnam par dpyod pa dang / bag med pa dang / bag yod pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / yi rang ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par 'tsho ba dang / mi 'tsho ba dang /
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pa dang / bag med pa dang / bag yod pa dang / yid 'byung ba dang / yi rang ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / shin tu sbyangs pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par 'tsho ba dang / mi 'tsho ba dang /
translated: analysis, heedlessness, heedfulness, disgust, delight, pliancy, unpliancy, vitality, nonvitality,

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang / rnam par grol ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dang / kun du sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / btang snyoms dang / rnam par grol ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba dang / kun du sbyor ba dang /
translated: shame, embarrassment, equanimity, liberation, roots of virtue, roots of nonvirtue, neutral roots, fetters,

original: 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang / sgrib pa dang /
analyzed: 'ching ba dang / bag la nyal ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang / kun nas dkris pa dang / zag pa dang / chu bo dang / sbyor ba dang / nye bar len pa dang / mdud pa dang / sgrib pa dang /
translated: floods,üîΩbonds,üîΩclingings,üîΩknots,üîΩhindrances,üîΩknowledges,

original: shes pa dang / bzod pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / bzod pa'o //
translated: and acceptances.

original: rgyas par du /
analyzed: rgyas par du /
translated: In detail,

original: sems pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: sems pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: there are three kinds of intention:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan @142a * //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan @142a * //
translated: wholesome, unwholesome, and neutral.

original: pa'o // yang sems pa drug ste /
analyzed: pa'o // yang sems pa drug ste /
translated: There are also six kinds of intention:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: mig gi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa nas yid kyi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa nas yid kyi rnam shes dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bar du'o //
translated: those associated with eye consciousness up to those associated with mind consciousness.

original: reg pa drug ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: reg pa drug ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are six kinds of contact:üîΩnamely,

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa nas yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from eye contact to mind contact.

original: dad pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dad pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of faith:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: namely,

original: bden pa gnyis dang / bden pa bzhi dang / dkon mchog gsum dang las dang 'bras bu la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa dang / de rnams kyi yon tan dang ldan pa la rab tu dad pa'i rnam pa dang / bdag gis de dag bstan par nus shing thob par nus pa'o zhes mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa gnyis dang / bden pa bzhi dang / dkon mchog gsum dang las dang 'bras bu la mngon par yid ches pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa dang / de rnams kyi yon tan dang ldan pa la rab tu dad pa'i rnam pa dang / bdag gis de dag bstan par nus shing thob par nus pa'o zhes mngon par 'dod pa'i rnam pa'i dad pa'o //
translated: Faith is of four kinds: faith in the Three Jewels, faith in the precepts of high birth, faith in the four noble truths, and faith in the law of karma and its results.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are two kinds of pliancy:

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs pa'o //
translated: pliancy of the body and pliancy of the mind.

original: shin tu ma sbyangs pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: shin tu ma sbyangs pa la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are two kinds of unpliancy:

original: lus shin tu ma sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu ma sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: lus shin tu ma sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu ma sbyangs pa'o //
translated: unpliancy of the body and unpliancy of the mind.

original: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: btang snyoms rnam pa gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three kinds of equanimity:

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms dang / so so skye bo'i shes pa'i rjes su 'gro ba so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ye shes kyi rjes su 'gro ba so sor brtags pa'i btang snyoms dang / so so skye bo'i shes pa'i rjes su 'gro ba so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms so //
translated: The equanimity of the arhats which is in conformity with the knowledge of the arhats, and the equanimity of ordinary people which is in conformity with the knowledge of ordinary people.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three roots of virtue:

original: ma chags pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi sdang ba dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rmongs pa med pa dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: ma chags pa dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / mi sdang ba dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rmongs pa med pa dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: non-greed as a root of virtue, non-hatred as a root of virtue, and non-delusion as a root of virtue.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three roots of non-virtue:

original: chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rmongs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / zhe sdang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / rmongs pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'o //
translated: greed as a root of non-virtue, hatred as a root of non-virtue, and delusion as a root of non-virtue.

original: lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are three roots of the indeterminate:

original: srid pa lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba dang / nga rgyal lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba dang / ma rig pa lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba'o //
analyzed: srid pa lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba dang / nga rgyal lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba dang / ma rig pa lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba'o //
translated: existence as a root of the indeterminate, pride as a root of the indeterminate, and ignorance as a root of the indeterminate.

original: mi rnams la ma rig pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: mi rnams la ma rig pa bzhag ste /
translated: Among humans, ignorance is set aside.

original: lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba gsum yin no zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: lung ma bstan gyi rtsa ba gsum yin no zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say: The three neutral roots are the three roots of neutral states.

original: kun du sbyor ba la dgu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba la dgu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: There are nine fetters:

original: rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba kun du sbyong ba dang / nga rgyal kun du sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba kun du sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa kun du sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang / khong khro ba kun du sbyong ba dang / nga rgyal kun du sbyor ba dang / ma rig pa kun du sbyor ba dang / lta ba kun du sbyor ba dang / mchog tu 'dzin pa kun du sbyor ba dang /
translated: the fetter of attachment, the fetter of anger, the fetter of pride, the fetter of ignorance, the fetter of view, the fetter of clinging to rules and ritual,

original: the tshom kun du sbyor ba dang / phrag dog kun du sbyor ba dang / ser sna kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom kun du sbyor ba dang / phrag dog kun du sbyor ba dang / ser sna kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: the fetter of doubt, the fetter of envy and the fetter of avarice.

original: de la lta ba kun @142b du sbyor ba la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la lta ba kun @142b du sbyor ba la gsum ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, the fetter of view has three types:

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dang / log par lta ba'o //
translated: the view of the transitory collection, the view grasping an extreme and wrong view.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i kun du sbyor ba la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fetter of clinging to rules and ritual has two types:

original: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'o //
translated: clinging to rules and ritual and overesteeming morality and ritual.

original: yang kun du sbyor ba la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang kun du sbyor ba la gnyis ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Furthermore, there are two kinds of fetters:

original: 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa kun du sbyor ba dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa kun du sbyor ba dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: fetters that are favorable to the lower realms and fetters that are favorable to the higher realms.

original: de la 'og ma'i cha dang mthun par kun du sbyor ba la rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la 'og ma'i cha dang mthun par kun du sbyor ba la rnam pa lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fetters that are favorable to the lower realms are of five kinds:

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: sensual desire, malice, the false view of individuality, the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices, and doubt.

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba la lnga ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba la lnga ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The fetters that are favorable to the higher realms are of five kinds:

original: gzugs la chags pa dang / gzugs med pa la chags pa dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la chags pa dang / gzugs med pa la chags pa dang / rgod pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa'o //
translated: attachment to form, attachment to the formless, excitement, conceit, and ignorance.üîΩWhen each of the afflictions is active, it performs ten functions.

original: de la nyon mongs pa re re rab tu 'jug pa na bya ba bcu bcu byed par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa re re rab tu 'jug pa na bya ba bcu bcu byed par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'di lta ste /
